alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 04 at 7:46PM PDT until April 05 at 1:45AM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Heavy rainfall that caused the Skokomish River to rise has ended and the river has crested and continues to fall below flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River At Potlatch. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, the Skokomish River will locally spill over its banks into low-lying areas of the Skokomish Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM PDT Monday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 14.7 feet early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 10/10/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 145 AM PDT.
